thread.title: Malaysia Wields Law Against ‘Fake News’ for First Time

author: Yantoultra Ngui
title: Malaysia Wields Law Against ‘Fake News’ for First Time
text:
KUALA LUMPUR, Malaysia—A foreign visitor became the first person convicted and sentenced to jail under a new law to punish those deemed to have published “fake news” after he criticized the police response to the slaying of a Palestinian engineer in Kuala Lumpur.
Salah Salem Saleh Sulaiman, 46 years old, a Danish national of Yemeni origins, pleaded guilty Monday at a court hearing. He was sentenced to a week in jail but opted to serve a month behind bars in lieu of paying a fine of about $2,600. He wasn’t represented by a... To Read the Full Story Subscribe Sign In
